page.title: 11RELIGION-ST GARMONS CHURCH
page.content: St Garmons church stands in the middle of the village.It is built of stone with a tiled roof.The spire is covered in cedar wood shingles .The porch has wooden beams which are made with oak. The porch is painted black and white. Behind the altar there are narrow lancet windows which are for defence. The church is the oldest building in the village. The pulpits date is 1673.The church has got a sundial in the grave-yard with steps going up to it ,a sundial is a kind of clock that they used to use. The original church was a simple cell on a raised hillock . The stone church was probable built in the 12th or 13th century. There was a school room attached to the church. The last full time rector retired in January 1982. It is now a linked church with Llansantffraid.
